intro: Petalostelma bracteolatum, commonly known as the bract-leaved petalostelma, is a tropical climbing plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, vine-like stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Petalostelma bracteolatum is often found in moist, shaded habitats in Southeast Asia.
